heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: On 04 January 2025, the rain lasted for 37.2 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  36.8mm accumulated and it fell at 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: Since 11 April 2025, the day with the most lightning strikes is 07 September 2025 when 23 were seen.

storm.status: A storm is in the area.  This is the first such event since 08 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (188°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1737 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 5.8°C) and outside temperature (up 5.3°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 6%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 414 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 739 m), light levels (up 3156 lux), and inside temperature (up 2.0°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 413.8m lower than yesterday, 551.5m lower than the past week, 738.8m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 696m and a peak of 1841m, averaging 840.9m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; you can expect comfortable, mild temperatures. Also, pleasant humidity levels and winds will be practically absent. Chance of light rain, clouds will occasionally block sunlight, and some sunny spells will occur. Weather should be calm and steady.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (88%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
